summary: If you want to read Sansan there's posts that are just their book interactions. So, limited time needed :) Sansa thinks about...
question: If you want to read Sansan there's posts that are just their book interactions. So, limited time needed :) Sansa thinks about him A LOT. I too loved Bethyl!!
answer:
Bethyl love forever!!! lol.

Really? I think I need to look into that because there are so many characters in GOT and I’m sure in one book there might not be a lot of Sansan interaction. And honestly there are some characters (main characters) that I’m just not interested in reading about even though I’m a huge bookworm lol.

Thanks for letting me know! I really appreciate it :)

If anyone has links to these posts they’d like to share I would love that!!

summary: 👏🏼 Sansa is gonna be the real MVP!! 👏🏼
title: 👏🏼 Sansa is gonna be the real MVP!! 👏🏼
body: I’m honestly hoping that Sansa goes to KL to save the day! Ppl have underestimated and seriously undermined our girl. I’m just guessing, but I feel like Sansa will gather troops and head to KL herself. If deepwood motte wasn’t already attacked by the white walkers (which I am almost certain it didn’t), I think Robett Glover will come into play. Jon being the rightful heir to the iron throne Sansa can use this info and have Glover aid her, as he never pledged to fight for a Targaryen (Danny) as we read from the scroll from s8x01, but before he did say “There will be more fights to come; House Glover will stand behind House Stark as we have for a thousand years, and I will stand behind Jon Snow, the King in the North!” He refused to fight the White Walkers war cuz Jon bent the knee to Dany, but now it’s a different story. If Danny wins, it won’t look so good for him either. I believe him and his troops will surely fight this time. I mean after the living won at Winterfell, he is most likely be a powerful lord in the north rn and we clearly know that he thought highly of Sansa being in charge when Jon had left. I think Sansa probably sent Arya to do that on her way. I mean something is going through Sansa’s mind! She is not gonna just stand there and watch bc whether Danny/Cersei wins they were both are a threat to the North. Plus, it only seems right that Sansa is the one to take down Cersei. She took down Ramsey and Littlefinger herself so why not her take down her biggest enemy herself! Sleep well cuz Sansa Stark is coming for y’all!!

summary: Why didn't Jon just give Ghost to Sansa? Her direwolf (that she seemed to care about much more than Jon has ever cared about...
body: Why didn’t Jon just give Ghost to Sansa? Her direwolf (that she seemed to care about much more than Jon has ever cared about Ghost) was forcefully taken from her and she would absolutely love to have a little loyal friend to keep her company. She’s also definitely the biggest supporter of house Stark and of a free and independent North in general so why shouldn’t she have a direwolf?

Ask Me Anything

summary: I’ve seen some people saying Sansa knew exactly what she was doing when she told Tyrion. All her time with Littlefinger and...
question: I’ve seen some people saying Sansa knew exactly what she was doing when she told Tyrion. All her time with Littlefinger and Cersei taught her a lot, which might just save them all. This was never going to be kept a secret, speaking from a viewer’s perspective it is just too important for the plot and (unpopular opinion) I love that Sansa took control of the situation. She could have done much worse than telling Tyrion, it was a calculated choice and a great one at that
answer: Of course she knew what she was doing. She owes nothing to Daenerys whatsoever. She’s sworn her no oaths. She doesn’t have to keep her secrets. Yes, she broke a promise she made to Jon but Varys is right, Dany is too strong for Jon. She bends him to her will too easily. Jon NEEDS Sansa fighting his corner because she’s got the brains and the ability to make difficult decisions for him, and she can see clearly where he cannot.

reblog.comment: Of course she knew what she was doing. She owes nothing to Daenerys whatsoever. She’s sworn her no oaths. She doesn’t have to keep her secrets. Yes, she broke a promise she made to Jon but Varys is right, Dany is too strong for Jon. She bends him to her will too easily. Jon NEEDS Sansa fighting his corner because she’s got the brains and the ability to make difficult decisions for him, and she can see clearly where he cannot.

Jon NEEDS Sansa fighting his corner because she’s got the brains and the ability to make difficult decisions for him, and she can see clearly where he cannot.

Jon NEEDS Sansa fighting his corner because she’s got the brains and the ability to make difficult decisions for him, and she can see clearly where he cannot.

AO3 Profile

FF.net

Ask Me Anything

summary: Personally I think they reduced Sansa to this one dimensional character whose only purpose now is to hate on Dany no matter...
question: Personally I think they reduced Sansa to this one dimensional character whose only purpose now is to hate on Dany no matter what. I mean I get why she doesn't like her but I really feel like they're destroying her character development... I love her and I truly think she's more than that. They're turning them all in these dumb pawns in Dany-Jon-Cercei game and it's annoying.
answer:
I completely disagree with you and I will defend her to the goddamned core of the earth. Dany rode into Winterfell with her armies and her dragons and condescended to Sansa like she was a child, refused to recognise the north as an independent nation once she won the seven kingdoms and proved herself willing to ride her battle-weary, injured armies and dragons down south just so she could sit on a throne. Daenerys expects special praise for offering those armies and dragons to the war against the White Walkers as if it wasn’t her war to fight, when as the ‘queen of Westeros’ she ought have offered those numbers because it is her job to protect her people. Sansa got the measure of her far better than Jon did. She knows that he can’t see Daenerys clearly because of his feelings for her.

With all of that in mind, if you were the Lady of Winterfell, how would you be able to rest for worry that your king and brother had not only bent the knee to this woman, but fallen in love with her, too? She is fighting tooth and nail and using every maneuver she can think of to protect her family and her people from Daenerys, and she’s thinking so far ahead of the rest of them all that she’s basically playing chess while they’re all stuck on checkers. How anyone could think that she is ‘one-dimensional’ is absolutely beyond me. Sansa is the absolute best of them. Arya has complete faith in her intelligence for a reason.

summary: As trash as this last episode was I don't think I've seen the fandom so united in a while. I mean it's on the back of fuck this...
question: As trash as this last episode was I don't think I've seen the fandom so united in a while. I mean it's on the back of fuck this show but still. Also an Arya, Dany, and Sansa fan last episode must've been hell for you as they trampled all 3 of their book arcs
answer:
I’m also a big Jaime and Missandei fan so this episode in truth, actually destroyed me. I was talking to a mate of mine and I was having a little sook about the episode and he as he does was like ‘Shazz, it’s a show, you’ve loved shows that have been ruined before’, I understood where he was coming from but this isn’t just a show to me, it’s a show that I’ve invested myself emotionally in for years. characters I have felt a special connection with for years.

i don’t love arya because she’s an asassin avenging her family, I love arya because she’s kind and cunning and pragmatic and a little bit fiery. and I don’t love Sansa because she’s now suddenly a cunning politician and secret conspirator, I love Sansa because she’s strong and clever and knows how to use her courtesy as armour. and I don’t love Dany because she’s some bad ass mad queen, I fucking love Dany because she’s compassionate and giving and full of heart and ready to lay down her life for her people.

And because so many of us love these characters we’ve banded together to hate this episode and honestly, it’s the best thing we can do right now is be there for one another. I’m a really fiery person and I express a lot of emotions and usually I would have cried last episode but I didn’t even shed a tear. I was so mad I couldn’t even cry for brienne or for missandei or ghost or gendry. I was literally shaking with rage the whole episode.

reblog.comment:
I’m also a big Jaime and Missandei fan so this episode in truth, actually destroyed me. I was talking to a mate of mine and I was having a little sook about the episode and he as he does was like ‘Shazz, it’s a show, you’ve loved shows that have been ruined before’, I understood where he was coming from but this isn’t just a show to me, it’s a show that I’ve invested myself emotionally in for years. characters I have felt a special connection with for years.

i don’t love arya because she’s an asassin avenging her family, I love arya because she’s kind and cunning and pragmatic and a little bit fiery. and I don’t love Sansa because she’s now suddenly a cunning politician and secret conspirator, I love Sansa because she’s strong and clever and knows how to use her courtesy as armour. and I don’t love Dany because she’s some bad ass mad queen, I fucking love Dany because she’s compassionate and giving and full of heart and ready to lay down her life for her people.

And because so many of us love these characters we’ve banded together to hate this episode and honestly, it’s the best thing we can do right now is be there for one another. I’m a really fiery person and I express a lot of emotions and usually I would have cried last episode but I didn’t even shed a tear. I was so mad I couldn’t even cry for brienne or for missandei or ghost or gendry. I was literally shaking with rage the whole episode.

trail.content_raw:
I’m also a big Jaime and Missandei fan so this episode in truth, actually destroyed me. I was talking to a mate of mine and I was having a little sook about the episode and he as he does was like ‘Shazz, it’s a show, you’ve loved shows that have been ruined before’, I understood where he was coming from but this isn’t just a show to me, it’s a show that I’ve invested myself emotionally in for years. characters I have felt a special connection with for years.

i don’t love arya because she’s an asassin avenging her family, I love arya because she’s kind and cunning and pragmatic and a little bit fiery. and I don’t love Sansa because she’s now suddenly a cunning politician and secret conspirator, I love Sansa because she’s strong and clever and knows how to use her courtesy as armour. and I don’t love Dany because she’s some bad ass mad queen, I fucking love Dany because she’s compassionate and giving and full of heart and ready to lay down her life for her people.

And because so many of us love these characters we’ve banded together to hate this episode and honestly, it’s the best thing we can do right now is be there for one another. I’m a really fiery person and I express a lot of emotions and usually I would have cried last episode but I didn’t even shed a tear. I was so mad I couldn’t even cry for brienne or for missandei or ghost or gendry. I was literally shaking with rage the whole episode.
trail.content:
I’m also a big Jaime and Missandei fan so this episode in truth, actually destroyed me. I was talking to a mate of mine and I was having a little sook about the episode and he as he does was like ‘Shazz, it’s a show, you’ve loved shows that have been ruined before’, I understood where he was coming from but this isn’t just a show to me, it’s a show that I’ve invested myself emotionally in for years. characters I have felt a special connection with for years.

i don’t love arya because she’s an asassin avenging her family, I love arya because she’s kind and cunning and pragmatic and a little bit fiery. and I don’t love Sansa because she’s now suddenly a cunning politician and secret conspirator, I love Sansa because she’s strong and clever and knows how to use her courtesy as armour. and I don’t love Dany because she’s some bad ass mad queen, I fucking love Dany because she’s compassionate and giving and full of heart and ready to lay down her life for her people.

And because so many of us love these characters we’ve banded together to hate this episode and honestly, it’s the best thing we can do right now is be there for one another. I’m a really fiery person and I express a lot of emotions and usually I would have cried last episode but I didn’t even shed a tear. I was so mad I couldn’t even cry for brienne or for missandei or ghost or gendry. I was literally shaking with rage the whole episode.

tags: not gendry waters becuse he will be with arya
summary: I keep thinking....
body:
I keep thinking….

I’ve seen a couple Gendry and Sansa theories and….

(PLEASE DON’T HURT ME I’M A GENDRYA STAN 😭😭💔💔)

People talk about how…

  • Arya is like Lyanna
  • Gendry is a young Robert

……

but people also have said

  • Sansa has some Cersei in her

Another Baratheon lost a Stark he loves forced to marry a woman he doesn’t love to “help” him rule

And Sansa gets into the same situation as Cersei

History doesn’t necessarily repeat but it does rhyme….

summary: We’re here to say goodbye to our brothers and sisters, to our fathers and mothers, to our friends. Our fellow men and women who...
caption: We’re here to say goodbye to our brothers and sisters, to our fathers and mothers, to our friends. Our fellow men and women who set aside their differences to fight together, and die together, so that others might live. Everyone in this world owes them a debt that can never be repaid. It is our duty, and our honor, to keep them alive in memory. For those who come after us, and those who come after them, for as long as men draw breath. They were the shields that guarded the realms of men, and we shall never see their like again.

tags: maybe the hound and brienne and lyanna mormont but almost noone else
summary: I'm just gonna go ahead and say it
body:
I’m just gonna go ahead and say it

I don’t even watch game of thrones anymore but Sansa and Arya Stark are the only valid characters in the entire show

SANSA “CHARACTER GROWTH” STARK DESERVES THE ENTIRE HECKING WORLD AND SHE’S PRETTY MUCH THE ONLY GOOD CHARACTER IN THE ENTIRE SERIES

Sansa is brilliant and she’s come so far and she’s a brilliant strategist who cares about the people and the future and literally no one ever listens to her and it drives me fucking Mad like GIRL YOU DESERVE SO MUCH BETTER

That’s the end of my ted talk thank you
